title: RFC 5321 — SMTP Protocol
description: Defines the core protocol for email transmission: SMTP.

title: RFC 7208 — Sender Policy Framework (SPF)
description: Describes how SPF is used to authenticate sending mail servers.

title: RFC 7489 — DMARC
description: Defines the Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting, and Conformance (DMARC) standard.

title: RFC 6376 — DKIM
description: Specifies DKIM, a method for authenticating email messages using public-key cryptography.

title: RFC 8461 — MTA-STS
description: Outlines a standard for enforcing SMTP TLS delivery via MTA-STS policies.

title: RFC 8657 — TLS Reporting (TLS-RPT)
description: Defines reporting methods for SMTP TLS negotiation failures.

title: RFC 9477 — Complaint Feedback Loop Address Header
description: Standardizes a header field for specifying complaint feedback loop addresses.

title: RFC 8058 — Signaling One-Click Functionality for List Email Headers
description: Defines the 'One-Click Unsubscribe' functionality for mailing lists.

title: RFC 2142 — Mailbox Names for Common Services, Roles and Functions
description: Specifies reserved mailbox names like 'abuse@', 'postmaster@', and others for standard roles.

title: RFC 5782 — DNS Blacklists and Whitelists
description: Describes DNS-based blacklists (DNSBLs) and whitelists for spam filtering.

title: RFC 2369 — The Use of URLs as Meta-Syntax for Core Mail List Commands and their Transport through Message Header Fields
description: Standardizes URL-based commands in list-related email headers (like 'List-Unsubscribe').
